intro: Halothamnus subaphylloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved halothamnus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, spiny stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale green to yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Halothamnus subaphylloides is adapted to arid environments and is considered a hardy, drought-resistant species.
